Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.surface

Class DrawingSurface

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • us.daveread.edu.graphics.surface.DrawingSurface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, SoundPlayer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DemoDrawingSurface, Fractal, GameOfLife, MultiDrawingSurface1, MultiDrawingSurface2, PenTest, Pong, ScrabbleBoard, SirQlateBoard, SwingWidgets, TurtleTest
    public abstract class DrawingSurface
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener, SoundPlayer, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Provides graphical services for a set of Drawables, allowing pixels, predefined shapes, and images to be drawn on a graphical workspace. Beyond basic graphical support, the class provides basic mouse event handling and simple sound playback capabilities.

    This class must be extended to create a drawing surface containing desired content. Drawables placed on the surface will be rendered. The subclass should use the following code (generally in the subclass' constructor) to initially display the drawing surface: new MainFrame(this);

    Author:
    readda
    See Also:
    Drawable, MainFrame, Serialized Form

        public DrawingSurface​(GuiMode mode)
        Create a drawing surface setup for rendering based on the supplied mode. The GUI mode impacts the scheme used for repainting the display.
        Parameters:
        mode - The operational mode of the UI

      • add

        public final void add​(Drawable component)
        Add a Drawable to be displayed to this DrawingSurface. Note that if the same Drawable instance is provided more than once, it will be redrawn for each occurrence. Also note that by default the Z-order (bottom-to-top) of the Drawables will match the order each is added. The first Drawable will be underneath all subsequent ones. The last one added will be on top of all the other ones.
        Parameters:
        component - The drawable component
        See Also:
        shiftZorder(Drawable, boolean)

      • add

        public final void add​(Drawable component,
                      boolean toTop)
        Add a Drawable to be displayed to this DrawingSurface. Note that if the same Drawable instance is provided more than once, it will be redrawn for each occurrence. Also note that by default the Z-order (bottom-to-top) of the Drawables will match the order each is added. The first Drawable will be underneath all subsequent ones. The last one added will be on top of all the other ones. If the toTop parameter is set to false, the Drawable will be added beneath all other Drawables.
        Parameters:
        component - The drawable component
        toTop - If true the Drawable will be placed on top of all others. If false it will be placed beneath all others.
        See Also:
        shiftZorder(Drawable, boolean)

      • remove

        public final void remove​(Drawable component)
        Remove a Drawable from the collection of added Drawables. If the same Drawable instance exists more than once in the collection, only the first one encountered (furthest back in Z-order) will be removed. No error occurs if an attempt is made to remove a Drawable that is not in the collection.
        Parameters:
        component - The drawable component

      • isComponentPresent

        public final boolean isComponentPresent​(Drawable component)
        Determine whether a Drawable is present on the DrawingSurface.
        Parameters:
        component - The component to located
        Returns:
        True if the component is found, false otherwise

      • shiftZorder

        public final void shiftZorder​(Drawable component,
                              boolean toTop)
        Update the Z-order position for a Drawable that is on the DrawingSurface
        Parameters:
        component - The component to be raised/lowered
        toTop - If true the Drawable will be placed on top of all others. If false it will be placed beneath all others.

      • clearSurface

        public final void clearSurface()
        Remove all Drawables from the DrawingSurface collection. This clears the DrawingSurface.

        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request"
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        getUserInput(String, String, boolean)

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           DialogType dialogType)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request"
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        dialogType - The type of dialog to be displayed. This determines the icon displayed in the dialog box.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        getUserInput(String, String, boolean)

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request"
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        defaultValue - The default input value to place in the user input field.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        getUserInput(String, String, boolean)

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           DialogPosition position)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        position - The position relative to the application window where the dialog should be created
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        DialogPosition

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           DialogPosition position,
                                           java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        position - The position relative to the application window where the dialog should be created
        defaultValue - The default input value to place in the user input field.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        DialogPosition

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           boolean hideInput)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        hideInput - If true the user's input will be replaced with dots to hide the entered characters. This may be useful for inputs such as passwords.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           boolean hideInput,
                                           DialogType dialogType)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        hideInput - If true the user's input will be replaced with dots to hide the entered characters. This may be useful for inputs such as passwords.
        dialogType - The type of dialog to be displayed. This determines the icon displayed in the dialog box.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           DialogPosition position,
                                           boolean hideInput)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        position - The position relative to the application window where the dialog should be created
        hideInput - If true the user's input will be replaced with dots to hide the entered characters. This is useful for inputs such as passwords.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        DialogPosition

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           DialogPosition position,
                                           boolean hideInput,
                                           java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        position - The position relative to the application window where the dialog should be created
        hideInput - If true the user's input will be replaced with dots to hide the entered characters. This is useful for inputs such as passwords.
        defaultValue - The default input value to place in the user input field.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        DialogPosition

      • getUserInput

        public final java.lang.String getUserInput​(java.lang.String title,
                                           java.lang.String userPrompt,
                                           DialogPosition position,
                                           boolean hideInput,
                                           java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                           DialogType dialogType)
        Obtain input from the user. This will prompt the user with a dialog box.
        Parameters:
        title - The title for the dialog box. If null it will default to "User Input Request" or "Protected User Input Request" based on the hiddeInput value.
        userPrompt - The message to be shown to the user requesting their input. If null it will default to "(no prompt supplied)"
        position - The position relative to the application window where the dialog should be created
        hideInput - If true the user's input will be replaced with dots to hide the entered characters. This is useful for inputs such as passwords.
        defaultValue - The default input value to place in the user input field.
        dialogType - The type of dialog to be displayed. This determines the icon displayed in the dialog box. If this is not set, the type will default to QUESTION.
        Returns:
        The value input by the user (this will be null if the user selects the Cancel button on the dialog)
        See Also:
        DialogPosition, DialogType

      • showMessage

        public final void showMessage​(java.lang.String windowTitle,
                              java.lang.String message,
                              DialogType dialogType)
        Display a message to the user. This will be presented as a dialog box using the correct look and feel for the dialog type. The dialog will be centered over the main window.
        Parameters:
        windowTitle - The title for the dialog box
        message - The message to be displayed in the dialog box
        dialogType - The type of dialog to be displayed. This determines the icon displayed in the dialog box. If this is not set, the type will default to INFORMATION.
        See Also:
        DialogType

        NO_OPTION, YES_OPTION

      • getLastGraphicsContext

        public static final java.awt.Graphics2D getLastGraphicsContext()
        Allows other graphics classes in this package to use the graphics context (NOT FOR DRAWING) for things like calculating font metrics. Any attempt to draw directly on this context will typically be ignored.
        Returns:
        The last graphics context used by this drawing surface

      • prepareForGuiUpdate

        public void prepareForGuiUpdate()
        This is a callback method that will be called just prior to the drawing surface being redrawn.

        Subclasses should override this if there are processing steps that should occur just before each GUI refresh.

      • handleKeyCode

        public void handleKeyCode​(int keyCode)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is pressed. The parameter will be the key code for the pressed key. Subclasses should override this method (or override handleKeyChar) in order to process keyboard input.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, handleKeyChar(char)

      • handleKeyChar

        public void handleKeyChar​(char keyChar)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is pressed. The parameter will be the key character associated with the pressed key. Note that some keys (for instance function keys) may not supply a meaningful character value. Use the handleKeyCode() method for a more reliable way to work with arbitrary keys being pressed. Subclasses should override this method (or handleKeyCode) in order to process keyboard input.
        Parameters:
        keyChar - The character code associated with the pressed key
        See Also:
        handleKeyCode(int)

      • handleKeyDown

        public void handleKeyDown​(int keyCode)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is pressed. The parameter will be the key code for the pressed key. Subclasses should override this method in order to detect a key being pressed.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, handleKeyUp(int)

      • handleKeyUp

        public void handleKeyUp​(int keyCode)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a keyboard key is released (after having been pressed). The parameter will be the key code for the pressed key. Subclasses should override this method in order to detect a key being pressed.
        Parameters:
        keyCode - The keycode of the pressed key
        See Also:
        KeyEvent, handleKeyDown(int)

      • handleExitRequest

        public void handleExitRequest()
        This is a callback method that will be called if the user attempts to close the program using the standard window closing control. Subclasses should override this method if there is logic to execute just before the program ends (such as saving a file).

      • handleMouseClick

        public void handleMouseClick​(boolean left,
                             int x,
                             int y)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a mouse button is pressed. The parameters indicate whether it was the left mouse button (versus right) as well as the X and Y locations on the drawing surface where the mouse click occurred. Subclasses should override this method in order to process mouse clicks.
        Parameters:
        left - True if it was the left mouse button that was pressed
        x - The X coordinate on the drawing surface of the click
        y - The Y coordinate on the drawing surface of the click

      • handleMenuClick

        public void handleMenuClick​(java.lang.String menuItemName)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a MenuBar or JMenuBar item is selected. The parameter to the method is the text of the menu item (label) that was chosen.

        Subclasses should override this method in order to process menu item interactions by the user.

        Parameters:
        menuItemName - The chosen menu item's text label
        See Also:
        MainFrame.setMenuBar(java.awt.MenuBar), MainFrame.setJMenuBar(javax.swing.JMenuBar)

      • drawableMouseClick

        public void drawableMouseClick​(Drawable e)
        This is a callback method that will be called if a mouse button is pressed while pointing to a drawable on the drawing surface. The parameter is the drawable that was clicked on. The mouse click check is made in Z-order from front to back. This means that if more than one Drawable is in the X,Y location of the click, the topmost one will be the one detected.

        Subclasses should override this method in order to process mouse clicks on their Drawables.

        Parameters:
        e - The Drawable that was clicked on
        See Also:
        checkForDrawableMatch(int, int)

      • checkForDrawableMatch

        private void checkForDrawableMatch​(int x,
                                   int y)
        Check each component on the drawing surface to see if it was clicked. If so, call the callback method passing the clicked component. Once a clicked component is found, no further components will be checked. The checks are made in Z-order from front to back. This means that if more than one Drawable is in the X,Y location of the click, the topmost one will be the one detected.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the mouse click
        y - The Y coordinate of the mouse click
        See Also:
        drawableMouseClick(Drawable)

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground​(double red,
                          double green,
                          double blue)
        Set the background color using the individual color components
        Parameters:
        red - The red component (0-255)
        green - The green component (0-255)
        blue - The blue component (0-255)

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow()
        Closes the associated MainFrame, ending program execution. This is done by sending a WINDOW_CLOSING event to the frame, the equivalent of clicking the windowing-system's exit icon.
